intro: Orthocarpus longispicatus, commonly known as the long-spined orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and the stems are often covered in stiff, spiny hairs. Orthocarpus longispicatus is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
